intro: Flueggeopsis pelas, commonly known as the silverleaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees, primarily in the genus Eucalyptus. It possesses specialized structures called haustoria that enable it to absorb water and nutrients from its host. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant ecological impacts on its host species.
